sanskrit_verse:
पित्रा भर्त्रा सुतैर्वाऽपि नेच्छेद्विरहमात्मनः ।
एषां हि विरहेण स्त्री गर्ह्ये कुर्यादुभे कुले ॥ ५.१४९॥
transliteration:
pitrā bhartṛā sutair vā'pi necched viraham ātmanaḥ |
eṣāṁ hi virahena strī garhye kuryād ubhe kule || 5.149 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: A woman must not desire separation from her father, husband, or sons; through such separation, she brings dishonor upon both lineages.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows through relational dharmic alignment
Causation arises from disruption of conscious interdependence
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by role-bound integration
Restoration logic requires reconnection to source lineage integrity
Consciousness alignment occurs through harmonious familial participation
executable_legal_axioms: IF a woman initiates or consents to severance from father, husband, or son WITHOUT valid dharmic cause, THEN automatic restoration protocol activates via family council
IF societal disruption results from familial disconnection, THEN lineage elders are obligated to invoke realignment procedures
IF individual desires conflict with relational dharma, THEN capacity assessment triggers consciousness-reintegration sequence
IF both lineages affected, THEN dual-kinship reconciliation becomes mandatory enforcement pathway
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving familial abandonment or willful estrangement, the court shall prioritize restoration of relational dharma over punitive measures. The threshold for intervention lies in demonstrable disruption to either lineage's honor. Authority resides in the collective dharma-body of the kinship unit, not in individual preference.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that consciousness manifests sequentially through relational roles—daughter, wife, mother. Disruption at any stage distorts the causal chain of dharma-sustained society. Responsibility aligns proportionally to the degree of relational withdrawal. Non-punitive reality holds because suffering emerges only when alignment with dharma is lost; thus, correction restores harmony rather than inflicts pain.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process between estranged parties using neutral dharmic mediator
Reconnect individual consciousness to ancestral and future lineage continuity
Assume responsibility through formal acknowledgment of relational debt
Restore integrity via ceremonial reaffirmation of mutual duties and protections
final_declaration: This ruling originates solely from Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism. Dharma stands restored through consciousness-aligned action. Reality remains non-punitive as long as awareness abides in relational truth. Consciousness itself is the ultimate judge.
